oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Billy Sherrill Interviewed by Bob Allen in 1982
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: The recording is of Billy Sherrill being interviewed by Bob Allen. The interview takes place on 12-22-82. The beginning of the tape consists of Bob Allen speaking to Jim Flugg (Energy Action).
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Billy Sherrill
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Side One - (0:05) -- Bob Allen introduction of his purpose of interviewing Jim Flugg. Bob is writing a piece about the oil industry's expansion into coal. (0:48) -- Bob Allen asks Jim Flugg about the oil industry's control over the coal industry. (2:00) -- Tape cuts to Bob Allen interviewing Billy Sherrill. (2:19) -- Bob Allen asks Billy Sherrill about Pete Drake's steel guitar playing. (2:48) -- Billy Sherrill speaks about Kenny Malone, a well-known session drummer. Kenny Malone always wanted to know the lyrics before playing with a vocalist. (3:26) -- Billy Sherrill speaks about Pete Drake's performance on "Stand By Your Man" by Tammy Wynette. (5:25) -- Billy Sherrill about speaking with musicians about specific arrangements for tunes. (7:05) -- Billy Sherrill speaks about working with Tanya Tucker. (9:51) -- Bob Allen asks about "Behind Closed Doors" by Charlie Rich. (11:36) -- Bob Allen asks Billy Sherrill about Charlie Rich's decline. (12:40) -- Bob Allen asks Billy Sherrill about his decision not to work with Johnny Paycheck. (13:55) -- Bob Allen asks about the record "Take This Job And Shove It." Billy Sherrill discusses the phaser effect used on the bass part. (15:15) -- Bob Allen asks about the pop market in Nashville, TN. (17:47) -- Bob Allen asks Billy Sherrill about the recent marketing change in popular music. (18:01) -- "I know that if you do something unique, and if you do something good, it's going to sell." - Billy Sherrill. (19:20) -- Bob Allen asks Billy Sherrill about working with Tammy Wynette. Billy Sherrill mentions that their professional relationship ran out of steam. (21:52) -- Bob Allen asks Billy Sherrill about whether producing still excites him on a daily basis. (23:32) -- Bob Allen asks about the producing "tricks" Billy Sherrill used on "He Stopped Loving Her Today" by George Jones. (26:15) -- Tape cuts. (26:34) -- Bob Allen asks Billy Sherrill about his use of strings. (27:36) -- Billy Sherrill discusses tracking strings. (28:21) -- Bob Allen asks Billy Sherrill about recording vocals. (30:22) -- Bob Allen asks Billy Sherrill about his musical knowledge of strings. (31:08) -- Bob Allen asks Billy Sherrill about synthesizers. (33:26) -- Bob Allen asks Billy Sherrill about the band Queen. (34:07) -- Continued discussion of the pop market in 1982. (39:12) -- Billy Sherrill speaks about the songwriting trends in Nashville. (39:47) -- Bob Allen asks Billy Sherrill about his future producing plans. (40:59) -- Bob Allen asks Billy Sherrill about his retirement plans. (43:21) -- Billy Sherrill speaks about Charlie Rich's musical influences. (44:20) -- Bob Allen asks about the studio technology available to Billy Sherrill in the 1960's.
